item.title: Can I make two different commands with same name? Read Here
item.dc:creator: @kaoticvela74 kaoticvela74
item.description:
@kaoticvela74 wrote:

You can, if you make the player rights different.

[code] if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("strpk")) && (p.playerRights > 1)) {
	if (playerLevel[2] >= 41 && playerLevel[2] <= 70) { [/code]

And then like this

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("strpk")) && (p.playerRights > 0)) { if (playerLevel[2] >= 1 && playerLevel[2] <= 40) {

So the first one, only mods or above can do it, and the second one, anyone will be able too. Let me know if you need more help.

Read full topic

item.title: Can I make two different commands with same name? Read Here
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

This is what I mean. Can I make one command named strpk that need these requirements: if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("strpk")) { if (playerLevel[2] >= 1 && playerLevel[2] <= 40) {

But then make another whole separate command that says this: if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("strpk")) { if (playerLevel[2] >= 41 && playerLevel[2] <= 70) {

The differences are the requirements needed to do the command. I am asking this because I am referring to my other thread: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,327824.0.html (Please read that thread if you can help me)

Read full topic
